name: biomni-quantify-amyloid-beta-plaques
title: Biomni: Quantify Amyloid Beta Plaques
description: Quantifies amyloid-beta plaques in microscopy images using image segmentation and analysis.
content:
Overview

Quantifies amyloid-beta (Aβ) plaques in microscopy images using image segmentation and analysis. This tool processes immunofluorescence or immunohistochemistry images of brain tissue stained for amyloid-beta, automatically detecting and measuring plaque burden, size distribution, and spatial characteristics, which are critical markers for Alzheimer's disease pathology.

Input Parameters

  • image_path (required): Path to microscopy image file of amyloid-beta stained tissue
  • output_dir (optional, default='./results'): Directory for output files and visualizations
  • threshold_method (optional, default='otsu'): Thresholding method for plaque detection ('otsu', 'manual', 'adaptive')
  • min_plaque_size (optional, default=50): Minimum plaque area in pixels to exclude noise
  • manual_threshold (optional, default=127): Threshold value if using manual thresholding

Input Format

{
  "image_path": "/path/to/amyloid_stained_section.tif",
  "output_dir": "./results",
  "threshold_method": "otsu",
  "min_plaque_size": 50,
  "manual_threshold": 127
}

Biological Use Case

This analysis is essential for:

  • Quantifying Alzheimer's disease pathology in human and animal models
  • Evaluating therapeutic efficacy in anti-amyloid drug trials
  • Characterizing plaque morphology (diffuse vs. dense-core plaques)
  • Studying regional distribution of amyloid pathology in brain
  • Correlating plaque burden with cognitive decline
  • Investigating genetic and environmental factors affecting amyloidosis
  • High-throughput screening of neuroprotective compounds

Output

Returns comprehensive plaque quantification including:

  • Total number of plaques detected
  • Total plaque area and percentage coverage
  • Mean, median, and distribution of plaque sizes
  • Plaque density (plaques per mm²)
  • Individual plaque measurements (area, perimeter, circularity)
  • Annotated image with detected plaques outlined
  • Plaque size distribution histogram
  • Summary statistics report

Category

physiology
